intro: Canthium homolleanum, commonly known as the African spurge, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Euphorbiaceae. It is native to tropical regions of Africa and is characterized by its striking yellow flowers and distinctive, spiny fruit capsules. The plant typically grows as an erect shrub, reaching heights of up to 2 meters. Its leaves are simple, alternate, and often have a rough texture. Canthium homolleanum is adapted to thrive in well-drained soils and is often found in open woodland or grassland habitats.
